title: Chickpea Soup with Tuma Cheese
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: 1tomato, peeled and diced, or 1 tablespoon estratto or tomato paste
½cup (100 g) chopped wild fennel or a mix of dill and parsley (optional)
Fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
6ounces (170 g) tuma cheese or provola, cut into small dice
Dried oregano, preferably wild, for serving
directions: 1. The night before, place the chickpeas in a bowl and cover with water to soak overnight.2. The next day, in a large pot over medium heat, cook the onion in olive oil until soft, about 8 to 10 minutes.3. Add the tomato, fennel (if using), garlic, and bay leaves. Drain the chickpeas and add to the pot. Stir to coat.4. Pour in the water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a gentle simmer, cover, and cook until chickpeas are tender, 2 to 3 hours. Skim off any foam during cooking.5. Once the chickpeas are soft, season the soup with salt and pepper.6. Add the ditalini and cook until al dente, about 8 minutes.7. Ladle the hot soup into bowls. Top with diced cheese and a pinch of dried oregano.
